---
title: "kOmegaSSTCC model"
---
The `kOmegaSSTCC` is a two-equation RANS turbulence model based on the Shear Stress Transport (SST) k-Ï‰ model developed by Menter [@Menter2003] as included in standard OpenFOAM distribution. It incorporates a curvature correction (CC) to account for the effects of streamline curvature and system rotation on turbulence production, following the approach proposed by Smirnov and Menter [@Smirnov2009].

## Model Equations
The transport equations for the `kOmegaSSTCC` model are given by:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\frac{\partial (\rho k)}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial (\rho k u_j)}{\partial x_j} &= P_k f_{r1} - \beta^* \rho k \omega + \frac{\partial}{\partial x_j} \left[ (\mu + \sigma_k \mu_t) \frac{\partial k}{\partial x_j} \right], 
\\
\frac{\partial (\rho \omega)}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial (\rho \omega u_j)}{\partial x_j} &= P_\omega f_{r1}- \beta \rho \omega^2 + \frac{\partial}{\partial x_j} \left[ (\mu + \sigma_\omega \mu_t) \frac{\partial \omega}{\partial x_j} \right] + C_D,
\end{aligned}
$$
where:
$$
\begin{aligned}
P_k &= \tau_{ij} \frac{\partial u_i}{\partial x_j}, \\
\tau_{ij} &= \mu_t \left( \frac{\partial u_i}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial u_j}{\partial x_i} \right) - \frac{2}{3} \rho k \delta_{ij}, \\
S_{ij} &= \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{\partial u_i}{\partial x_j} + \frac{\partial u_j}{\partial x_i} \right), \\
P_\omega &= \frac{\gamma \rho}{\mu_t} P_k, \\
C_D &= 2(1 - F_1)\frac{\rho \sigma_{\omega 2}}{\omega} \frac{\partial k}{\partial x_j} \frac{\partial \omega}{\partial x_j}.
\end{aligned}
$$

Turbulent viscosity is computed as:
$$
\mu_t = \frac{a_1 \rho k}{\max(a_1 \omega, S F_2)}
$$
with $S = \sqrt{2 S_{ij} S_{ij}}$.

The curvature correction function $f_{r1}$ is defined as:
$$
f_{r1} = \max\left[\min\left(f_{r}, 1.25\right), 0\right]
$$
where
$$
f_{r} = (1 + c_{r1})\frac{2r^*}{1+r^*}\left[1 - c_{r3} \arctan\left( c_{r2} \tilde{r} \right)\right] - c_{r1}
$$
with
$$
\begin{aligned}
r^* &= \frac{S}{\Omega}, \\
\tilde{r} &= 2 \Omega_{ik}S_{kj} \left[\frac{D S_{ij}}{D t} + (\epsilon_{imn}S_{jn} + \epsilon_{jmn}S_{in})\Omega_m^{rot}\right]\frac{1}{\Omega D^3} \\
\Omega_{ij} &= \frac{1}{2} \left( \frac{\partial u_i}{\partial x_j} - \frac{\partial u_j}{\partial x_i}  - 2 \epsilon_{mji}\Omega_m^{rot}\right), \\
\Omega &= \sqrt{2 \Omega_{ij} \Omega_{ij}}, \\
D^2 &= \max(S^2, 0.09 \omega^2).
\end{aligned}
$$
Here $\Omega_m^{rot}$ is the system rotation rate.

## Model Coefficients
For the standars `kOmegaSST` model coefficients see [@Menter2003] or the OpenFOAM manual. The curvature correction coefficients are set to:

- $c_{r1} = 1.0$
- $c_{r2} = 2.0$
- $c_{r3} = 1.0$
  

## Notes on OpenFOAM implementation

:::{.callout-note}
Current implementation does not include the system rotation $\Omega_m^{rot}$ in the calculation of $\Omega_{ij}$.
:::

See the OpenFOAM manual for details on basic `kOmegaSST` model implementation.
